definitions.definition: a soft, green or grey growth that develops on old food or on objects that have been left for too long in warm, wet air:
examples: There was mould on the cheese.

definitions.definition: to make a soft substance have a particular shape:
examples: This plastic is going to be moulded into plates.

definitions.definition: to try to change or influence someone:
examples: He kept trying to mould me into something he wanted me to be.

definitions.definition: to fit the body very closely:
examples: She was wearing an extremely tight costume that moulded to/round the contours of her body.
